title: Chat: Messages are not being delivered in a timely manner

labels.name: priority 1: high
labels.description: an issue that is extremely important to fix, that interferes with the majority of users, occurs ofte

milestone.description:
Priorities **in priority order** for the 0.12 milestone:  

**1. Improve performance**
- Focus on eliminating any UI freezes when the user clicks on something and the app does not display an immediate response.  Target: the app should ideally respond to all user input within 50ms, but let's start with identifying the longest UI freezes and trying to fix the worst UI freezes first.
- Speed and responsiveness of switching between community channels, and 1on1 and ad-hoc group chats is particularly important, especially for channels and chats that contains a lot of history.  We should aim for about 250ms delay in the *worst* case if possible.  Having a lot of history in a channel should not slow channel switching down.
- DB perf optimisations.  
- Move things to async and off main thread
- See Alex's great profiling work for possible tasks (Alex to continue focusing on perf. for this release cycle)
- "user facing performance in everyday app usage" is the top priority, but any task that improves performance is worthwhile

**2. Finish development of token based functionality from 0.11**
- Optimise No. queries made by owner node when checking member tokens (Pascal)
- Community encryption should automatically switch on/off depending on community permissions (issue #9942)
- Implement the 'Admin' role (issue #10114)
- Airdrop to community members (in addition to addresses)
- Optimise gas required by collectable minting smart contracts (issue #9943, GravityBlast)
--- After collectable minting gas optimisation is complete, start work on Asset minting contracts (GravityBlast)
- Complete token remote destruct UI
- Remove 'Community Permissions Settings', 'Community Tokens' and 'Discord Import Tool' feature flags (issue #10115)
- Thoroughly test, and fix all bugs found. 
- Anything else related to Community level token permissions, collectable minting, airdropping, and remote destructing that didn't make it into 0.11

**3. Finish implementing the ability for Community Owners and Admins to drag and drop channels and categories into different orders**

**4. Finish anything related to the initial pairing process for syncing that wasn't completed in 0.11** (Igor)

**5. Improve Mutual Contacts functionality to improve reliability and pay off tech debt** (Mishka)

**6. Complete Community Directory Curation dApp integration inc. Featured functionality** (Patryk)
 
**7. Backend for the Profile Showcase**

**8. Identity Verification** (required for 'Profile Showcase')

**9. Fix bugs, bugs and more bugs!**
- Esp. find the cause of and fix the longstanding bug of some 'requests to join' not arriving for hours/days after they were sent!
- Many 'fit and finish' bugs for the UI team

**--- For the Wallet team ---**

1. Continue feature development inc. kicking off development of the activity screens
2. 'All accounts' section.  The ability to return all tokens owned by the user in all accounts (excluding watch only accounts) is also required for the Showcase functionality
3. Widen scope of 'backup to waku' and 'syncing' so that all relevant Wallet user state is backed up and synced between devices
4. Continue to ensure Wallet functionality is performant.
5. Fix wallet bugs

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

Several instances have been reported now of messages not arriving soon after they were sent.

For example:

1. DMs that do not arrive until a day later or after a restart
2. Messages in chats that arrive later and appear in the history, sometimes changing the context of a message sent in multiple parts.
3. In a group chat, having members of the group chat not being able to see messages from 1 or more parties while the rest of the users can see everyone's.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Send DM and ask recipient if they can see it straight away
2. Observe messages after a restart or simply arriving later and being inserted into the history of the previous day
3. Chat with a group and confirm if all members can see each message

#### Expected behavior

Messages arrive in a timely manner

#### Actual behavior

The arrival time of the messages is unpredictable from the UI

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: 0.10.0 RC3
- Operating System: Mac
i was able to see this issue as well recently, i failed to receive messages in my DMs until i restarted the app several times.
@jrainville can we assign to someone to investigate?

> i was able to see this issue as well recently, i failed to receive messages in my DMs until i restarted the app several times.

Did you note a low number of peers on any of the accounts?
i am around 29 now but indeed i did not think of noting the peers count before i did the restart :(

If possible, if anyone experiences this again, note the peer count. It's very important to know if this is a network issue or an app issue.

I don't think I can assign anyone to this until then, because they will be investigating blindly.
I experienced it today as well. My peer count was at around 45. Post restart, the direct message from @glitchminer appeared immediately.
Hi @jrainville , I saw this again today where the DM was only received after a restart. There were 21 peers before and after. Both of us were on version 0.10.

Ok, I wonder if it's related to some sort of contact desync? Can you guys check your contact list to see if you are really mutual contact with each other? @osmaczko @glitchminer 
It's worth checking also next time it happens, before restarting, in case it fixed itself for some reason.

A contact issue sounds sounds plausible. Before restart the contact state was showing as mutual contact on my side and after restarting @osmaczko is now showing as pending contact request - which doesn't really make sense either because it was only delivered after restarting.

Yeah, some things are messed up with contact states + messaging.
We used to disable sending messages when not mutual, but somehow, it works now. But then people might not receive the messages. There are a couple of issues about mutual contacts opened. Most of them are being handled by @MishkaRogachev but he was off this week.

Yeah, this may be it. @glitchminer is shown as non-contact.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33099791/224349874-21aa16d1-506f-4446-9d2c-949ff3194fde.png)

we have a logic in nim to ignore messages from non-contacts. That would explain why they appear only after restart.

I think the contacts miss-synchronization happened to me in similar case:
1. Send a contact request to userA
2. Get the request accepted from userA
3. Restore the account
4. Send/receive message to/from userA

Cool, I'm glad we found the root cause. We then need to make it way clearer when people are not mutual.
Which version were you guys on?

> Cool, I'm glad we found the root cause. We then need to make it way clearer when people are not mutual. Which version were you guys on?

0.10.0

Same, 0.10.0. 

Making it clearer that there will be an issue because of not currently being mutual contacts will help. Why the mutual contact state somehow reverted to pending may also need looked at, as to start the chat in the first place and have message history we were previously mutual contacts at some time.

@jrainville i suppose this happen durning latest contact request changes and affect old created accounts. Also mutual contact not recovered properly after account has been restored. So what should be fixed in the PR:
* Ensure that current contact requests mechanism works properly
* Mutual contacts recovery

or just
* Fix ability to receive messages from not mutual contacts (maybe with additional rules)

> Fix ability to receive messages from not mutual contacts (maybe with additional rules)

We used to have a mechanism to get the first 1-1 message from a user as a message in the activity center. Maybe it was removed from designs or maybe we just lost it? @John-44 do you know? IMO, it can still be useful in those cases where someone lost their mutual contacts without knowing. That way, they can receive an AC notification from contact X and realize that they are no longer a contact.

> Ensure that current contact requests mechanism works properly

Otherwise, I think "Ensure that current contact requests mechanism works properly" is still important to fix. Right now, it seems a little broken. If you lose your contacts, you can still chat with the person, but it should be blocked. I know we've had a couple of issues where the "blurb" with the hand image was showing inappropriately, but people could still write. It should be that we show that "blurb" and image + button to add contact when you are not mutual and also disable the input.
Let me see if I find the design for that.
edit: I can't find it :shrug: 

> Mutual contacts recovery

As for "Mutual contacts recovery", that would obviously be a good solution, but it's not that simple. We already have some other efforts on this anyway, so don't bother with it.

Found an easier to reproduce:
1. Send a contact request to userA
2. Get the request accepted from userA
3. Remove userA from contacts
4. Send/receive message to/from userA
So first thing - we just need to disable or delete chat for non contacts 1-to-1
Yes, other than the single initial message that arrives with a contact request, it should not be possible to 1on1 message with somebody who is not a contacts request.

> @MishkaRogachev thanks for investigation! Indeed, there are 2 problems:
> 
> * chatting with non-contact
> * losing mutual contact connection randomly (become Pending instead)

Created separated issue for the first problem: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/9899

Closing this issue as the second problem was fixed here https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/9899
and the first problem is gonna be resolved in https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/9899
@jrainville , just checking, both problems are resolved by the same issue?

Sorry, I messed up. I checked with @MishkaRogachev and the second issue is actually by design. I can't seem to find the issue tracking that, but it is planned to make it clearer that contacts come back as pending when recovering.
